column5: Hit the ice at around noon and headed 16km out to a mid lake shelf that seems to produce fish this time of year. Four hours of great action, fished in 70' with a small williams half half . Lots of fish landed and all promptly released (a few posed for a photo). Laker bite was on good with some bigger fish more than willing to hit.  Whitie's seemed to need a little more coaxing. Travel was not a problem for my sled I even passed a few trucks. Snow averaged around 13"-15" with many 2-3' drifts.  Good luck to all heading out in the next few days, I know I'll try to squeeze a few more trips in.  RF
Nice looking Lakers there RF....did that Whitey make it to the table?  Cheers  Craig
Nice way to spend the day nice looking laker's  rob
Nope all released today. But a few will be let go into a frying pan on Fri I hope! Rf
Nice lakers man !!!!.  ..well done,great pics too   cheers
Some well fed fish there ! Thanks for postin...
im gonna try to head out friday, let me know
Very nice fish there bud.  Great pics.  Way to go.  Joey
Some nice looking fish there. WTG
wish i was there... great picts, congrats!!
looks like you did good Ryan, unlike the rest of us who went to Big Bay. Me and Jay D were the only ones who caught fish in our group (small fish). Now go and cook em' up tomorrow.  "JENOOOOOOOOOO"
